question: Medicaid & the Family Access to Medical Insurance Security Plan (FAMIS) for American Indians and Alaska Natives
text:
Medicaid & the Family Access to Medical Insurance Security Plan (FAMIS) for American Indians and Alaska Natives
          
        
Medicaid and FAMIS
are available to qualifying federally recognized American Indians and Alaska Natives.
If youre eligible for services from the Indian Health Service (also known as an Indian hospital or Public Health Service (PHS)), tribal health programs (also known as tribal 638 programs or tribal health clinics), or urban Indian programs (known as I/T/Us), including Contract Health Services:

You dont have to pay any out-of-pocket costs for Medicaid or FAMIS coverage and healthcare services.

Certain Indian resources and payments arent counted for Medicaid and FAMIS eligibility, making it easier for some people to qualify.

You can continue to get services through an I/T/U even if the I/T/U is not a provider in your programs managed care network.
American Indians and Alaska Natives can apply for coverage through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace or the
Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS)
. Those who are interested in applying for Medicaid (Medical Assistance or MA)  but are not sure if they qualify can go to
https://www.dmas.virginia.gov/for-applicants/applying-for-medicaid/
to learn more about how to apply for Medicaid. The screener will tell individuals which program they may qualify for based on their responses to the screening questions. If an individual is screened as potentially eligible for health care insurance coverage through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace and not Medicaid, they will be directed to apply directly through the
www.marketplace.virginia.gov
link on the screening results page.
